pr_title: Search page continuation token takes extra apiVersion and nextLink

timeline.message: Search page change for json serialization

timeline.bodyText:
Could we just wrap the IOException in an UncheckedIOException and bubble that up.
throw logger.logExceptionAsError(new UncheckedIOException(e));
timeline.author: alzimmermsft

replies.bodyText: I feel like this should be thrown as an ArgumentException for an "Invalid continuationToken" if you folks have a similar exception in Java.  Users didn't explicitly serialize the continuationToken themselves so an error message saying it failed to deserialize might be kind of confusing given that we have a bunch of other serialization related magic happening all over the place in these APIs.
replies.author: tg-msft

replies.bodyText: Based on that I would go with IllegalStateException which is meant to cover scenarios where the application ran into an unrecoverable state, IllegalArgumentException is reserved for scenarios where a user passed in a bad value.
replies.author: alzimmermsft

replies.bodyText: That is the only case we're going to get an error for though - when the user passes us a continuationToken that doesn't correctly deserialize.
replies.author: tg-msft

replies.bodyText:
Thanks for the discussion!
nextLink and nextParameter are both provided by service.
apiVersion is sdk library enum.
These three things all from SDK and above, and user has no way to manipulate it.
For serialization code, I will go with IllegalStateException.
For deserialization code, user is able to pass wrong continuation token. I will go with IllegalArgumentException
replies.author: sima-zhu

timeline.bodyText: This should be implementing PagedResponse, not PagedResponseBase. Right now this is saying that we have a paged response whose value list is SearchResult and whose headers are type SearchResult.
timeline.author: alzimmermsft

replies.bodyText: Changed to PagedResponseBase<Void, SearchResult> for convenience getter.
replies.author: sima-zhu

timeline.bodyText: nit: Could we rename this createContinuationToken, this isn't setting it.
timeline.author: alzimmermsft

timeline.bodyText: This isn't the full continuation token value.  You're only setting this to the serialized version of getNextPageParameters().
timeline.author: tg-msft

replies.bodyText: Will make this return the encoded string.
replies.author: sima-zhu

timeline.bodyText: Why is this changing from SearchRequest to string?  It's not actually the continuation token but just the next page params part of it.
timeline.author: tg-msft

replies.bodyText: Remove nextParameters getter and use getContinuationToken return encoded token instead.
replies.author: sima-zhu

timeline.bodyText: This should still give you back the SearchRequest data structure.  We should do the JSON serialization of that value in createContinuationToken.
timeline.author: tg-msft

timeline.bodyText: I'm not sure this is correct - doesn't the continuationToken include the apiVersion and nextLink?  I think we'd only do this for the nextPageParameters property.  We also need to verify that this has an apiVersion we know how to parse and throw an exception if it has an API Version we don't recognize.
timeline.author: tg-msft

replies.bodyText: You are right when we have the getContinuationToken return encoded one, it includes more items. I will fix the code here.
replies.author: sima-zhu

replies.bodyText: Will do apiVersion check as well.
replies.author: sima-zhu

timeline.message: Make change on search page getContinuationToken
Added a model helper for continuation token
